TopicTitle: :~Can I Has More Stockalike Greeble Mods?~: <3

Articles.Content: Is there anyone willing to make Really Good Looking Stockalike Greeble parts?
You want useless parts?
Pretty Much...
Well that's a pretty silly idea but I suppose if they were made physics-less, it wouldn't be the worst.
Oh please, greebles are what make the world go round.
I've been looking for a cosmetics mod for a long time. Tubes/pipes, wire harnesses, tank butts for procedural parts of different variants, decals... Stuff like that.

Since I had to look it up: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greeble

Basically all the useless doodads on the side of ships to make it look cool
heh I can see this being useful for lots of things like a set of building blocks for modders that know how to weld in thier config files but not how to model

Some players think it's all about efficiency, anything that's inefficient wouldn't be done in real life, I'm not totally convinced of that (Space shuttle anyone?)

But seeing as KSP is a game and that people are amazingly creative with the parts available I think it'd be cool to have stuff that's just for show

Who knows what players could make from them...

heh I can see this being useful for lots of things like a set of building blocks for modders that know how to weld in thier config files but not how to model

Actually this is worth exploring. I've changed my mind. Unfortunately I already voted down this thread so if everyone reading it could offset my mistake, that would be great.

In fact, I'm pretty sure I'd like to take this on. Everyone give me ideas for individual models.

Edited January 2, 2015 by Cpt. Kipard

So, just throwing out random ideas:

Pipes, Structural/utility looking blocks, micro meteorite shielding plates, a complex looking but useless stick, raised surfaces of different shapes (futuristic hexagon is usually used), dummy windows, exhaust ports, fins, light boxes, flaps...

hmm... If greebles were made an opensource part week theme would people honestly start participating? Cause if so it'd be a great way to generate a lot of greebles in a short amount of time... or someone could just start a collaborative greeble project for the sake and love of greebles alone but that's too sensible.
An automated greeble parallax mapped decal would be really cool.
Abusing the two-piece part module (fuel lines and struts) could be a cool way to make 'procedural greebles' so you could run tubes and hoses all over your ship!

Abusing the two-piece part module (fuel lines and struts) could be a cool way to make 'procedural greebles' so you could run tubes and hoses all over your ship!

That is really clever. I can't believe I didn't think of this. There are some limitations though, like you can't really have curved pipes.

So, just throwing out random ideas:

Pipes - OK

Structural/utility looking blocks -What does that mean?

micro meteorite shielding plates - I need some examples

a complex looking but useless stick - What does that mean?

raised surfaces of different shapes (futuristic hexagon is usually used) - OK

dummy windows - OK

exhaust ports - O.O That's just reckless. It'd have to be like..less than a meter wide at most.

fins - I need some examples

light boxes - What's that?

flaps - Like aircraft flaps?

I still need more ideas people.

Edited January 10, 2015 by Cpt. Kipard

Structural/utility box: A box with some raised/indented surfaces, and wirings/pipe on its sides, like the body of this model (can just be texture instead of actual mesh to improve performance):

Micro meteorite shielding - something like the middle of this craft where there are hexa-like edge plates (I am not very good at describe this, am I?)

Complex looking stick - something like this:

Exhaust ports - It could be shielded!

Fins - the most useless part of all, no realistic spaceship would possibly need one, so I am pulling some sci-fi stuff as examples - see those angled fins everywhere on the ship(maybe they are antennas?):

Light box - something like this - basic greeble stuff, with lights: Doesn't have to be complex in mesh either, just a simple cube works, since we have the raised surfaces to make it more interesting, it just need some lights to give some interesting visual in the dark.

Flaps - I was thinking something like the engine flap from Karbonite Plus engine:

More ideas:

Computer terminal (not sure why anyone would want one outside the pod).

Exposed mechanisms, like this one:

Dummy Hatches.
Since no one else is posting, I might have to assume that this isn't a very popular idea.

Sounds cool, especially for movie makers. I love the idea, and would probably mess around with it, but once the novelty wore off, I doubt I would use it any more. I tried using the handrail pack, but I wasn't able to get my kerbals to use them properly and once they lost all functionality (for me) I removed them, despite liking the aesthetics. Not to mention the "realists" that will start screaming for having all of these "non-aerodynamic" and "useless, unrealistic" parts hanging off of ships.

These parts are old but still work/look good. They are not useless either.

In the thread there is a config posted to update them to have useful prices etc.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69539-0-23-Stockalike-parts-for-useful-esthetics
On the last page, there is a link to the release of a .90 version.
I still think sized tank butts for procedural parts would be great..
I'm not so sure that would be appropriate...

Aww..

so nasty this thread got discontinued!

Moar greeblz. Gib greeblz.

I would help with the modeling, but I do my work in SketchUp and the conversion output is not the greatest sometimes
I like this idea.
